result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael B Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Probation may be transferred to defendant's county of residence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. May transfer to Jefferson County Jail.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Michael B Curry in court, in custody, with Attorney William J. Reddin.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Reddin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2   YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS      **Consecutive to any other sentence**   **Transfer of probation allowed to county where Defendant resides** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days straight time (Consecutive to any other sentence)   *May be served at Jefferson County jail*

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

**DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH**
Dated 11/25/14, from Atty Reddin to Judge Carter, regarding upcoming sentencing on 12/03/14. Supporting documents/letters attached.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Jefferson County Jail.
Sentencing hearing on December 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael B Curry in court, in custody, with Attorney William J. Reddin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant Guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  Counts #2-4 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Reddin requests a sentencing date.  Bail is revoked.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Jefferson County jail.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
